intro: Rhynchanthera corumbaensis, commonly known as the Corumbá orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Brazil. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the Atlantic Forest biome. The plant features a short, underground rhizome and produces slender, erect stems with few leaves. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, often with a slight purplish tinge, and are arranged in a raceme. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened and is of interest for conservation and botanical research.
